meanings.definition: The process by which nerve cells communicate with each other.
meanings.sent1: Neurotransmission is like a phone call between nerve cells.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study neurotransmission to understand how our brain works.
meanings.sent3: During a game of telephone, neurotransmission can get mixed up!
meanings.sent4: In a busy city, neurotransmission is the constant chatter of information.
meanings.sent5: Imagine neurotransmission as tiny messengers running between nerve cells.

meanings.definition: The transmission of signals between neurons in the brain.
meanings.sent1: Neurotransmission is crucial for our brain to function properly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching ways to enhance neurotransmission in the brain.
meanings.sent3: When the brain is tired, neurotransmission can slow down like a traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: In a crowded room, neurotransmission is like whispers passing through the crowd.
meanings.sent5: Visualize neurotransmission as a network of roads connecting different parts of the brain.

meanings.definition: The sending of chemical messages from one neuron to another.
meanings.sent1: Neurotransmission involves the release of chemicals to pass messages.
meanings.sent2: Understanding neurotransmission helps in treating neurological disorders.
meanings.sent3: In a dance party of neurons, neurotransmission is the music playing between them.
meanings.sent4: Like a secret code, neurotransmission ensures the right message reaches the correct neuron.
meanings.sent5: Picture neurotransmission as a relay race where chemicals pass the baton between neurons.
